analyzed: spyi de'i bdag nyid gcig pa yang yul der gnas pa'i 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That single nature of the universal is the nature of the related object, because

original: bum pa la sogs pa las skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul las bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas snga ma'i yul las gnas pa gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa las skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul las bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas snga ma'i yul las gnas pa gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the substance of a pot, etc., which arises from a place, is the nature of the related object, because it abides in the place of the prior substance of the pot, etc.

original: yul tha dad pa dang cig car 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa dang cig car 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is a related object that is different and simultaneous.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs der gnas pa'i 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo nyid yod na de dang 'brel pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs der gnas pa'i 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo nyid yod na de dang 'brel pa mi rung ste /
translated: If it were otherwise, that is, if the nature of the related object existed in the place, it would be impossible for it to be related to that,

original: rdzas snga ma dang 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdzas snga ma dang 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would be impossible for it to be related to the prior substance.

original: de bas na rdzas gcig la nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi spyi ni dus de nyid na yul tha dad pa'i rdzas dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rdzas gcig la nges pa'i bdag nyid can gyi spyi ni dus de nyid na yul tha dad pa'i rdzas dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a universal that definitely has the same nature as a particular substance does not exist in a different place at that time.

original: 'brel pa yod na yang spyi ni gsal ba snga ma dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid du nges pas gsal ba snga ma las gnas pa'i dus de nyid na gsal ba'i yul tha dad par 'gro bas gnas pa med pa de yang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na yang spyi ni gsal ba snga ma dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid du nges pas gsal ba snga ma las gnas pa'i dus de nyid na gsal ba'i yul tha dad par 'gro bas gnas pa med pa de yang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if it did exist, since the universal is definitely the same nature as the previous manifestation, it would not remain in the previous manifestation at that time, and it would not go to a different place of the manifestation. To demonstrate that this is contradictory, he says:

original: rten pa gcig po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rten pa gcig po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: â€œIf it is the same one that abides,â€ and so on.

original: gang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi tshe ste /ğŸ”½dus de nyid la gsal ba gzhan la 'gro bar khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi tshe ste / dus de nyid la gsal ba gzhan la 'gro bar khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: â€œIn which it abidesâ€ means at that time.

original: gsal ba snga ma'i nges pa'i bdag nyid des spyi de'i gsal ba snga ma de nyid @185b la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba snga ma'i nges pa'i bdag nyid des spyi de'i gsal ba snga ma de nyid @185b la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is accepted that it goes to another manifestation at that time, it is not tenable to say that the universal that is the same nature as the previous manifestation does not remain in that previous manifestation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig po de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig po de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThat one aloneâ€ and so on.

original: spyi gcig gis gsal ba snga ma de nyid la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: spyi gcig gis gsal ba snga ma de nyid la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: A single universal is in the very same individual that is manifest, and it is not in the very same individual that is not manifest.

original: rang bzhin dag cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro ;ğŸ”½/ thams cad la ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dag cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro ; / thams cad la ste /
translated: Because the nature of being in a single thing and the nature of being in many things are mutually exclusive.

original: gsal ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas la'o //
analyzed: gsal ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas la'o //
translated: â€œIn allâ€ means in the substance that is to be produced, that is, in the individual that is to arise.ğŸ”½â€œIn allâ€ means in the substance that is to be produced, that is, in the individual that is to arise.

original: thams cad du ste skye bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas las snga ma yang 'dir gang la rdzas bskyed par bya ba'i yul de la /
analyzed: thams cad du ste skye bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas las snga ma yang 'dir gang la rdzas bskyed par bya ba'i yul de la /
translated: In that place where the substance that is to be produced exists, the universal that existed previously exists there as well.

original: spyi sngar yod pa kho na yod pas de na yang yod pa min zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: spyi sngar yod pa kho na yod pas de na yang yod pa min zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement â€œIt does not exist thereâ€ is not established.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis gnas pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni spyi ni rnam pa gang gis gsal ba la gnas pa de nyid kyis skye bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas la yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis gnas pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni spyi ni rnam pa gang gis gsal ba la gnas pa de nyid kyis skye bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas la yang yin no //
translated: â€œIn all aspectsâ€ means that the universal is in the individual in whatever aspect, and it is in the substance that is to be produced in that very same aspect.

original: shes pa gang la spyi'i rang bzhin mthong pa'i rten yod pa de ni rigs tha dad pa'i rdzas thams cad rnam pa thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gang la spyi'i rang bzhin mthong pa'i rten yod pa de ni rigs tha dad pa'i rdzas thams cad rnam pa thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: That cognition which has a basis for seeing a universal is a universal of all substances of different kinds in every way.

original: de ltar yin na yang ba lang la rta zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang ba lang la rta zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Even though this is so, it is said that a cow is a horse.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rta la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rta la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said that a horse is a cow, etc.

original: rdzas gang rta la gnas pa'i bdag nyid yod pa de de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdzas gang rta la gnas pa'i bdag nyid yod pa de de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The substance which is the nature of a horse is that, i.e., the word is construed in this way.

original: go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhi tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhi tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: Because it is the cause of understanding, the plural ending is used even though the basis is different.

original: yang na rta la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa dang ldan pa'i bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na rta la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa dang ldan pa'i bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Or, the phrase â€œthat which is the nature of a horseâ€ is a copulative compound with a reason.

original: phyis bdag nyid kyi sgra dang tshig gnyis pa'i 'bru mang po pa yin no //ğŸ”½de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyis bdag nyid kyi sgra dang tshig gnyis pa'i 'bru mang po pa yin no // de'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ste /
translated: Later, the plural ending is used with the word â€œnatureâ€ and the second word.ğŸ”½The cognition of its nature

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rdzas nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rtogs pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rdzas nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rtogs pas so //
translated: is the cognition of the characteristic of that substance as it has been explained.

original: de ltar zhes bya bas ni rta'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya bas ni rta'o //
translated: The word â€œthusâ€ means â€œin that way.â€

original: rdzas nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir ba lang gi rdzas yin no zhes de ltar shes par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /ğŸ”½de yang gzhan gyis 'dod pa kho na yin te rta zhes bya ba ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir ba lang gi rdzas yin no zhes de ltar shes par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te / de yang gzhan gyis 'dod pa kho na yin te rta zhes bya ba ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But it is not known that the substance of the cow is the substance of the horse, because they are related to their own substances.ğŸ”½But if it is claimed that the substance of the horse is the substance of the cow, then the horse would not be the object of the cognition of the horse.

original: rta'i shes pa'i rdzas nyid kyi rgyu mtshan nyid ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rta'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: rta'i shes pa'i rdzas nyid kyi rgyu mtshan nyid ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rta'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: The substance of the cognition of the horse is not the reason for the substance of the horse, but rather the horse is the reason for the horse.

original: de yang ba lang la rta nyid yod pa ma yin te /ğŸ”½gsal ba rigs mthun pa kho na dag la thams cad du @186a * //
analyzed: de yang ba lang la rta nyid yod pa ma yin te / gsal ba rigs mthun pa kho na dag la thams cad du @186a * //
translated: And the horse does not exist in the cow.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis gnas pa'i bdag nyid can yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis gnas pa'i bdag nyid can yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that all the aspects of a single class of things are always present in all the individuals of that class.

original: der re zhig rta ni rta'i blo'i yul yin la /
analyzed: der re zhig rta ni rta'i blo'i yul yin la /
translated: In that case, the horse is the object of the cognition of the horse.

original: de la rta'i blo'i yul gyi rdzas gnas pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can du rang bzhin gang gis rta la gnas par 'gyur ba de nyid kyis ba lang la sogs pa la yang gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rta'i blo'i yul gyi rdzas gnas pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can du rang bzhin gang gis rta la gnas par 'gyur ba de nyid kyis ba lang la sogs pa la yang gnas pa yin no //
translated: The substance that is the object of the cognition of a horse is the nature of the substance that abides in the horse. By that very nature, it also abides in the cow and so on.

original: de ltar na ba lang dag kyang rta'i blo'i yul nyid thob cing /
analyzed: de ltar na ba lang dag kyang rta'i blo'i yul nyid thob cing /
translated: In that case, cows would also attain the status of being the object of the cognition of a horse.

original: gzhan du na rdzas ni rta'i blo'i yul gyi rdzas gnas pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rdzas ni rta'i blo'i yul gyi rdzas gnas pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the substance would not be the nature of the substance that abides as the object of the cognition of a horse.

original: gcig la rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ni ma yin gyi gang gis rta la gzhan du gnas shing ba lang la gzhan du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig la rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ni ma yin gyi gang gis rta la gzhan du gnas shing ba lang la gzhan du gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is not that a single thing has two natures, but rather that it abides differently in the horse and differently in the cow.

original: ba lang la gnas pa'i rdzas nyid tsam du snang la rta'i blo'i yul gyi rdzas gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: ba lang la gnas pa'i rdzas nyid tsam du snang la rta'i blo'i yul gyi rdzas gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid yod du zin kyang /
translated: The mere substance that abides in the cow appears, and although the nature of the substance that abides as the object of the cognition of a horse exists,

original: mi snang ba de bas na ba lang la rta yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi snang ba de bas na ba lang la rta yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: las med pa nyid kyi phyir yang byed pa ste /

translated: And because the action does not exist, the agent does not exist.

analyzed: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa nyid kyang shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin na'o //

original: las ni gnas pa med phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs gzhan du rtogs pa la 'das pa ni las zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: las ni gnas pa med phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la 'das pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs gzhan du rtogs pa la 'das pa ni las zhig pa yin la /

original: ma 'ongs pa ni las gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni las gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: de dag ces bya ba ni shes pa dang sgra dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni shes pa dang sgra dag go //
translated: â€œThoseâ€ refers to cognition and sound.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i las med pa yang shes pa dang brjod pa dag gi min te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i las med pa yang shes pa dang brjod pa dag gi min te /
translated: Past and future karma are not the causal-signs of cognition and expression,

original: rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because they are not causes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: â€œBecause they do not existâ€ and so on.

original: de dag ni shes pa dang brjod pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa dang brjod pa dag go //
translated: â€œTheyâ€ refers to cognition and expression.

original: med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: â€œDo not existâ€ and so on explains this.

original: 'dis dngos po ston par byed cing gsal bar byed pas na nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis dngos po ston par byed cing gsal bar byed pas na nus pa ste /
translated: â€œCausal-signâ€ means that which reveals and makes known an entity.

original: don byed par nus pa'o //ğŸ”½med pa @192a * //
analyzed: don byed par nus pa'o // med pa @192a * //
translated: â€œCapable of effective actionâ€ means that which is able to perform a function.

original: gang la bral ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la bral ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: â€œAbsenceâ€ means that which is devoid of existence.ğŸ”½â€œDevoidâ€ means that which is without.

original: gang gi phyir med pa ni don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa ni don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Because that which is absent is devoid of the ability to perform a function,

original: de lta bur gyur pa de ji ltar sgra dang shes pa dag gi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de ji ltar sgra dang shes pa dag gi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: how could such a thing be the causal-sign of cognition and expression?ğŸ”½But if you assert that an absence is a causal-sign,

original: ci ste med pa yang rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste med pa yang rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dngos po de'i de nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says, â€œThe reality of that real thing,â€ etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œThereforeâ€ means â€œfor that reason.â€

original: 'das pa ni 'gag pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'gag pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: The past is the nature of cessation.

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ngo bo ma thob pa can yin no //

original: las las gsal ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang shes pa dang brjod pa dag ni rgyu mtshan nyid du spyi smra bas mi 'dod de /
analyzed: las las gsal ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang shes pa dang brjod pa dag ni rgyu mtshan nyid du spyi smra bas mi 'dod de /
translated: Others, such as manifestation, etc., are not accepted by the Grammarians as the mere causes of cognition and expression, because of the reason.

analyzed: gsal ba ni las kyi rten gyi rdzas so //

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni brda'i bag chags dang / de yongs su smin pa dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni brda'i bag chags dang / de yongs su smin pa dag gzung ngo //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ includes the habitual tendencies of the convention and their complete maturation.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba'i sgra dang shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba'i sgra dang shes pa'o //
translated: â€œThoseâ€ refers to the word and cognition.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i sgra dang shes pa dag rgyu mtshan med pa yin na rigs grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i sgra dang shes pa dag rgyu mtshan med pa yin na rigs grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if the terms and cognitions of the cooker, etc. are without a basis, then the reason is not established.

analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni sgra dang shes pa dag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ indicates that the terms and cognitions would either exist or not exist.

original: / gal te ci'i phyir rigs grub ce na /
analyzed: / gal te ci'i phyir rigs grub ce na /
translated: If it is asked why the reason is established,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: he says â€œthatâ€ and so on.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa ste /
translated: The cognition and expression are not different.

original: sgra'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are asserted to be the basis of the term.

original: ji ltar sgra 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i yul la de dag rgyu mtshan med par 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar gzhan dag la yang yin pa'i phyir rgyu ni ci rigs su rtogs /

translated: Just as the terms cooker, etc. engage their objects without a basis, so it is for others as well. Therefore, the reason is established as appropriate.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gzhan dag rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gzhan dag rtogs par byed de /
translated: He makes understood another position with â€œIf it is said . . . â€ and so on.

original: nus pa ni las kyi rten gyi'o //
analyzed: nus pa ni las kyi rten gyi'o //
translated: The capacity is that of the basis of action.

original: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /

original: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i yang rgyu mtshan nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i yang rgyu mtshan nus pa yin no //
translated: The reason for the cognition of the cooker, etc. is the power.

original: rjes 'gro med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: rjes 'gro med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed de /
translated: By â€œbecause there is no concomitance,â€ etc., he refutes.

original: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i nus pa ni 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan min /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i nus pa ni 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan min /
translated: The power of the cooker, etc. is not the reason for the word â€œcooker,â€ etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rdzas dang 'dra bar nus pa ni rdzas las ldog pa med pas rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas dang 'dra bar nus pa ni rdzas las ldog pa med pas rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir ro //

original: @192b don rjes su 'gro ba med pa can yang /
analyzed: @192b don rjes su 'gro ba med pa can yang /
translated: And that which does not have concomitance with the object

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: khas len na rigs su rtags pa'i rgyu med pa can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is accepted, it follows that there is no reason for the inference.

original: gal te nus pa tha dad pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa tha dad pa kho na yin no zhe na /

original: 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: he says â€œcooker,â€ etc.

original: yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rdzas las gzhan pa'i nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rdzas las gzhan pa'i nus pa nyid do //
translated: â€œIt does not existâ€ means that the power is not different from the substance.

original: gal te yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If it did exist,

original: de nyid de nus pa ni 'tshed pa po la sogs pa don gyi bya ba la nye bar sbyor ba'i rgyu'i phyir nus pa'i rten gyi rdzas ni nye bar sbyor ba ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid de nus pa ni 'tshed pa po la sogs pa don gyi bya ba la nye bar sbyor ba'i rgyu'i phyir nus pa'i rten gyi rdzas ni nye bar sbyor ba ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would follow that the substance that is the basis of the capacity would not be connected with the action of cooking, because the capacity is the cause that connects the agent of cooking, etc.ğŸ”½with the action of the object.

original: 'tshed pa la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa de ni rdzas de'i nye bar sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa la sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa de ni rdzas de'i nye bar sbyor ba yin te /
translated: That capacity which is the agent of cooking, etc. is the connection of that substance,

analyzed: de ltar na brgyud pas kyang 'tshed pa la sogs pa la rdzas kyang nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams ba'o //

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba ste /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba ste /
translated: Now, if you say that the capacity is different from the substance,

analyzed: nus pa don gzhan du gyur pa la dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no need for a capacity that is a different object.

analyzed: 'di ltar 'tshed pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i nus pa dngos po la yang rdzas nus pa gang gis sbyor bar byed pa'i nus pa de yang gal te tha dad par khas len pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i nus pa la rdzas nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir /

original: nus pa gzhan rdzas las tha dad par khas len na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nus pa gzhan rdzas las tha dad par khas len na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: if you accept that the capacity is different from the substance, it follows that it is untenable.

original: nus pa de la yang nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa gzhan brtag par bya zhing de la yang gzhan zhes bya ba thug pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nus pa de la yang nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa gzhan brtag par bya zhing de la yang gzhan zhes bya ba thug pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is connected to that capacity, you must imagine another different capacity, and because it is connected to that, you must imagine another different capacity, and so on. The consequence is that there is an infinite regress.

translated: Therefore you must say that the capacity to accomplish cooking and so on is connected to the substance alone, without any other different capacity.

analyzed: de ltar na rdzas de ni nus pa la nye bar sbyor bar 'dod na /

translated: why do you not maintain that the substance is connected only with the activity that is characterized by the objectâ€™s function, such as cooking?

original: rdzas de dang don gyi bya ba'i bar du nus pa don med pa brtag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: rdzas de dang don gyi bya ba'i bar du nus pa don med pa brtag pas ci zhig bya /

original: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since this is not the case,

analyzed: 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba la nus pa zhes @193a * //
translated: the so-called potentiality for the activity of the object, such as cooking,

analyzed: bya ba 'dis rdzas kho na brjod pa yin no //
translated: is simply a designation for the substance itself.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can de 'tshed pa la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
translated: It is the effect of that, i.e., it is that which has as its effect the cooking, etc.

analyzed: rdzas de yang gsal ba gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir rdzas de las 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra dang shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the substance does not continue in a different manifest form, the word and the cognition that follow the substance are not called â€œthe cooker,â€ etc.

original: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra smos pa ni nye bar mtshan pa yin no //
translated: The mention of â€œsoundâ€ is a synecdoche.

original: gal te 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i rdzas la 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa spyi yod pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra dang shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i rdzas la 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa spyi yod pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra dang shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If the universal â€œcookâ€ and so on exists in the substance of the cook and so on, it is the cause of the sound and cognition that conforms to it.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If, etc.

original: gal te 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa spyi yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa spyi yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you assert that the universal â€œcookâ€ and so on exists, then

original: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i bya ba sgrub nus pa'i gnas skabs dang por te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i bya ba sgrub nus pa'i gnas skabs dang por te /
translated: at the very beginning, when the substance is capable of performing the action of cooking, etc.,

original: rdzas 'byung ba dang dus mnyam kho nar de'i rdzas la 'phrod pa 'du bas 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzas 'byung ba dang dus mnyam kho nar de'i rdzas la 'phrod pa 'du bas 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it would be related to the substance by the connection of inherence.

analyzed: de ltar na byis pa de dang po skyes pa yang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: In that case, even a newborn infant would be the object of the cognition and expression â€œcook,â€ etc.

analyzed: dang po'i ci ste min pa de'i tshe phyis kyang mi 'gyur te rdzas de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not so at the beginning, then it will not be so later, because there is no difference in the substance.

original: rdzas la ni dus thams cad du 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rdzas la ni dus thams cad du 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: The substance is always the cooker, etc.

original: 'on kyang dang por mngon par mi gsal ba de bas na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dang por mngon par mi gsal ba de bas na /
translated: However, at first it is not manifest.

original: sgra dang shes pa dag gi rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra dang shes pa dag gi rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhe na /

original: yod nyid sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: yod nyid sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says, â€œExistence, etc.,â€

analyzed: gsal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dang po kho nar gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œManifestâ€ means that it becomes manifest at the very beginning.

original: yod nyid sogs bzhin du ste /
analyzed: yod nyid sogs bzhin du ste /
translated: â€œLike existence, etc.,â€

original: dper na yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa lta bur ji srid rdzas yod pa dang don byed pa'i dbang po nyid na rung pa'i yul na gnas pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa lta bur ji srid rdzas yod pa dang don byed pa'i dbang po nyid na rung pa'i yul na gnas pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: If it is said, â€œBut if it is not manifest at the beginning,â€ etc.,

original: yod pa'i don la ste rigs kyi rten la'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i don la ste rigs kyi rten la'o //
translated: he explains, â€œIn the case of an existent object, i.e., a universal.â€

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba de'i ni 'phrod pa 'du ba spyi'o //ğŸ”½res 'ga' ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba de'i ni 'phrod pa 'du ba spyi'o // res 'ga' ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The general rule is that the universals are in contact with the universals.ğŸ”½Because they are not occasional.

original: dus thams cad du yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist at all times.

original: de nyid brtan par bya ba'i phyir /ğŸ”½don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /

analyzed: thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa dang brjod pa thams cad ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Another says, â€œWell then, all cognitions and expressions that pervade all would be indeterminate.â€

original: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to prove that, he says, â€œBecause there is no reason for the arising of a cognition or expression of one thing in regard to another.â€

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i bag chags rab tu sad pa las rnam par rtog pa skye ba la sogs pa de dag rgyu mtshan med pa bkag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i bag chags rab tu sad pa las rnam par rtog pa skye ba la sogs pa de dag rgyu mtshan med pa bkag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Arenâ€™t the arising of conceptual thoughts and so on from the activation of habitual tendencies just as they are refuted as being causeless?

original: rgol ba'i skabs med do zhe na /
analyzed: rgol ba'i skabs med do zhe na /
translated: There is no opportunity for debate.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi nang gi mtshan nyid 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi nang gi mtshan nyid 'dod la /
translated: Thus, they assert that the characteristics of those are internal.

original: rgyu mtshan de yang 'ga' zhig dang nye ba dang skal ba med pa'i phyir thams cad rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam sems so //

translated: But because that reason is not related to some and is not related to others, it would follow that everything would be the cause of all conceptual thoughts.

original: rgyu mtshan med par yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'dir phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'dir phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Without a reason for existing means that here, because there is no external reason, it should be viewed as â€œwithout a reason.â€

original: de dag rgyu mtshan med pa can ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag rgyu mtshan med pa can ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
translated: They are not without a reason means that this is the assertion of the philosophical school.

original: khyad par can yin pa ni rgyu mtshan dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyad par can yin pa ni rgyu mtshan dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de bas na bag chags kyi khyad par rgyu mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de ni de nyid la de'i dngos @195b por nges pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skye bar byed kyi thams cad du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to
translated: The meaning of the summary is that the predisposition that comes from seeing things as they are is the cause for the arising of the conception that is determined in relation to that, but not for the arising of all conceptions.

original: // de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can gyi phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan yod pa ma yin pa de la rnam par rtog pa mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: // de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can gyi phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan yod pa ma yin pa de la rnam par rtog pa mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: â€œSuchâ€ refers to the fact that the conceptualization of the non-existent external objective referent does not cease.

original: 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: It is only conceptualization.

original: de nyid ni rmi lam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed de /

translated: The referent objects of cows and so forth, of matted hair and bees, of non-existent rabbit horns, and so forth, and of the imprints of philosophical systems,

translated: are imputed by the power of the imprints of oneâ€™s own philosophical tenets. Conceptualization arises in the form of the qualities of the imputed entity, such as being the effect of the primary nature and so forth.

analyzed: de dag gi med pa nyid kyang le'u gsum pa las bstan par 'gyur ro //

translated: The mutual contradiction of the philosophical positions is also demonstrated by the phrase â€œsimultaneously in one place,â€ etc., because they are not superimposed by philosophical positions.

original: ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin gyi /
translated: Those conceptual thoughts arise in regard to nonexistent objects, such as those in a dream, etc., even though they do not have an essence that is a real entity. Therefore, they do not occur in every way in regard to all objects.

translated: First, in regard to the objects that are the bases of the mistaken consciousnesses of dreams and cataracts, and in regard to the tenets that are heard in accordance with oneâ€™s own philosophical position, and in regard to the tenets that are imputed, and in regard to the nonexistence of rabbit horns and the son of a barren woman, and so on, which are the bases of the arising of conventions, there is the differentiation of the object.

translated: â€œWeâ€ and so on indicates the same meaning as â€œone realizes,â€ and so on.

analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar dha ba dang seng ldeng la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa de la ba lang la sogs pa tha dad par mtshungs pa la /

analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa'i blos nges pa'i dbang las dngos po dag la rjes su 'gro ba'i ldog pa kho na yin gyi /

translated: Here, the SÄá¹ƒkhya says, â€œIf exclusion . . . â€ and so on.

analyzed: dngos po'i rjes 'gro ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The â€œfollowing after thingsâ€ is the sameness of the nature of things.

analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dngos por gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œOtherâ€ means that which is a thing.

analyzed: de'i tshe gcig gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni gzhan la sogs pa'i ru mi 'gyur ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po dag ste /

translated: He proves that with â€œThat, etc.â€ The nature of that seed which produces a sprout does not exist in others, such as earth, etc., but exists in the opposite, which is characterized by the superimposition of the intellect.

original: gang yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: That is the producer.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi myu gu bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //

translated: â€œIf thatâ€ and so on means that the meaning of the words is as follows.

original: de'i ni zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi'o //

translated: â€œItsâ€ means the seedâ€™s.

analyzed: gzhan gyir yang zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: â€œOf anotherâ€ means of the earth, etc.

analyzed: sa la sogs pa de ni myu gu skyed par byed pa'i sa bon gyi rang bzhin des sa bon de las tha dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba yod do //
translated: That earth, etc., would not be different from the seed, because of the intrinsic identity of the producer of the sprout. Therefore, there is no intrinsic identity that is concomitant.

analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin tha dad pa 'ga' zhig la yang ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig byed pa yin te /

analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la / bdag gcig la zhes bya ba ni rgyu tshogs pa tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid gang gis skyed par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i bdag nyid de ni rgyu de dag gi nang nas rgyu gcig la yang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, â€œIf, in regard to a single self, etc.â€

analyzed: gcig po de nyid kyis 'bras bu byas pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa don med par 'gyur /
translated: In regard to a single self, the nature of the collection of causes that is not different is the nature that is asserted to be the producer. That nature exists in each of the causes, because that single one itself produces the effect. Therefore, the cooperating causes would be meaningless.

original: ldog pa smra ba la yang gnas skabs tha ma la thams cad bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu gzhan don med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ldog pa smra ba la yang gnas skabs tha ma la thams cad bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu gzhan don med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Also, in regard to the proponent of reversal, since all are produced in the final state, wouldnâ€™t the other causes be meaningless?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: tshogs pa de dag ni gnas skabs tha mkho na la de 'dra bar nus pa yod do //

original: gzhan rtag par smra ba dag la ni @197a * //
analyzed: gzhan rtag par smra ba dag la ni @197a * //
translated: In regard to the proponents of permanence,

analyzed: rtag tu de'i ngo bor yod pa'i phyir rgyu gzhan don med par 'gyur ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa 'chad par byed de /

translated: To explain the passage beginning with â€œif,â€

analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po du ma 'bras bu gcig byed pa ste /
translated: he says: if, because of the identity of nature, many things produce one effect,

original: skyed par byed pa yin na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i don de dag gi tha dad pa med pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de ni rgyu gcig nye ba la yod do //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yin na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i don de dag gi tha dad pa med pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de ni rgyu gcig nye ba la yod do //
translated: that is, if they generate it, then that nature which produces the nondifference of those things that are asserted to be causes exists in the presence of a single cause.

original: de bas na gnas skabs thams cad du rgyu dang ma bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gnas skabs thams cad du rgyu dang ma bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is never separated from the cause,

original: gang la gnas pa de la gcig kyang skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la gnas pa de la gcig kyang skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would produce the effect even when it is alone.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says: â€œin this way,â€ and so on.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo de spyi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ni sa bon la sogs pa nye ba gcig las kyang byed mi nus so //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo de spyi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ni sa bon la sogs pa nye ba gcig las kyang byed mi nus so //
translated: That nature which is not different, which produces the effect of the universal, cannot be produced even from one of the proximate causes, such as the seed.

original: tha dad pa rnams kyi khyad par rnams dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams kyi khyad par rnams dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is devoid of the differences of the different things.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin de las sa bon las don gzhan sa la sogs pa'i khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin de las sa bon las don gzhan sa la sogs pa'i khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That nature which is different does not exist as a difference of the seed, etc., from the thing different from the seed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par yod na tha dad pa med pa nyams pa'i phyir tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par yod na tha dad pa med pa nyams pa'i phyir tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there were a difference, there would be a loss of non-difference, and there would be difference.

original: tha dad pa med pa skyed par byed par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin de yang sa bon 'ba' zhig po de la yang yod pas sa bon gcig gi gnas pa la yang de'i zhes bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed pa 'dod pa'i 'bral
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa skyed par byed par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin de yang sa bon 'ba' zhig po de la yang yod pas sa bon gcig gi gnas pa la yang de'i zhes bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed pa 'dod pa'i 'bral
translated: And that nature which is asserted to be the producer of non-difference exists in that very seed alone, so that even in the state of a single seed, there is the production of that which is asserted to be the producer of the nature of non-difference.

original: ba ste / 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba ste / 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no destruction.

original: yon tan gsum ni bdag nyid thams cad thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gsum ni bdag nyid thams cad thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the three qualities are ascertained to exist in all ways at all times.

original: gang khyad par gyi gnas kyi khyad par de dag lhan cig gnas pa nges pa med pa'i phyir bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang khyad par gyi gnas kyi khyad par de dag lhan cig gnas pa nges pa med pa'i phyir bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the distinctions of the locus of distinction are not ascertained to exist simultaneously, they are separated.

original: de dag kyang khas blangs nas bshad kyi gzhan du na gnas pa po ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ldog pa med pa'i khyad par dag kyang ji ltar bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang khas blangs nas bshad kyi gzhan du na gnas pa po ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ldog pa med pa'i khyad par dag kyang ji ltar bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, this is explained by accepting that, otherwise, since the locus is permanent, the distinctions would not be separated, since they are not reversed.

original: de dag skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dag skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The word â€œproducingâ€ is a distinction.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is this not accepted?

original: lhan cig byed byed pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed byed pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, â€œbecause the simultaneous and non-simultaneousâ€¦â€

original: de bas na sa bon la @197b sogs pa'i gnas pa'i gcig la yang skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na sa bon la @197b sogs pa'i gnas pa'i gcig la yang skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because the nature of producing exists in the one that is the locus of the seed, etc.,

original: gnas pa med pa ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par ni'o //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par ni'o //
translated: â€œwithout abidingâ€ is a distinction.

original: gnas pa gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba sa bon la sogs pa gzhan gnas pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba sa bon la sogs pa gzhan gnas pas kyang 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even by the mere presence of one of them, the seed, etc., the effect would be produced, because of the presence of the other causal factors.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa ni 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa ni 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And even if there were no transformation of the seed, etc., the effect would be produced.

original: de bas na spyi gnas na yang lhan cig byed pa'i nang nas khyad par gcig dang bral na'ang 'bras med phyir /
analyzed: de bas na spyi gnas na yang lhan cig byed pa'i nang nas khyad par gcig dang bral na'ang 'bras med phyir /
translated: Therefore, even though the universal is present, the effect does not occur when one of the specific causal factors is absent from among the collection of causal factors.

original: khyad par rnams las de dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: khyad par rnams las de dag 'byung ste /
translated: The effect arises from the specific causal factors,

original: 'bras bu de dag 'byung gi spyi las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de dag 'byung gi spyi las ni ma yin no //
translated: not from the universal.

original: 'bras bu de ni myu gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni myu gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The effect is the sprout, etc.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: lhan cig byed pa du ma'i thun mong du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa du ma'i thun mong du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is common to many causal factors.

original: lhan cig byed pa du mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa du mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is produced by many causal factors.

original: khyad par gcig dang bral na yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par gzhan dang bral na yang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par gcig dang bral na yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par gzhan dang bral na yang ngo //
translated: Even if one of the specific causal factors is absent,

original: 'dis ni ldag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldag pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the negation.

original: khyad par thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: In particular, the phrase â€œin the case of all particularsâ€ and so on indicates the concomitance.

original: de bas na khyad par kho na dag la 'bras bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin gyi spyi la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par kho na dag la 'bras bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin gyi spyi la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is concomitant with and occurs only in the case of particulars, not in the case of universals.

original: de ni ma bral na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni ma bral na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, ÅšÄntaraká¹£ita says, â€œEven if they are not separated from it.â€

original: khyad par gcig gnas pa la ma bral na yang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo las 'bras bu de 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gcig gnas pa la ma bral na yang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo las 'bras bu de 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if a particular is not separated from the state of abiding, the effect does not occur from it, because it is not a different entity.

original: 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid rnam par 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid rnam par 'byed par byed de /
translated: The phrase â€œthe effectâ€ and so on clarifies this point.

original: 'ga' zhig las 'byung zhing skye ba de nyid chos nyid yin te de gang la yod pa de ni de las byung ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las 'byung zhing skye ba de nyid chos nyid yin te de gang la yod pa de ni de las byung ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skyed par byed pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising and origination of an effect is a property of reality. If something does not have that property, it is not a producer, because it is not separated from that which is produced.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed par 'dod pa lhan cig byed pa'i nang nas gcig gnas pa la yang bral ba nyid yod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed par 'dod pa lhan cig byed pa'i nang nas gcig gnas pa la yang bral ba nyid yod pa yin la /
translated: The cause that is asserted to generate the nature that is not different is one that is present among the co-operating causes.

original: gang gis na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur /
translated: How could this fault arise?

original: 'on kyang bdag nyid gcig pa yin pa du ma skyed par byed pa yin no zhes smras so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag nyid gcig pa yin pa du ma skyed par byed pa yin no zhes smras so zhe na /
translated: But it is said that the cause that is one generates the effect that is many.

original: 'dir gang tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gang tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, he says, â€œIf the effect were to exist in the assembly of causes and conditions,â€ and so on.

original: khyad par gang tshogs pa dang bral ba dag las 'bras bu yod pa med pa 'dra bar khyad par de nyid las 'bras bu skye'o //ğŸ”½de la yod na zhes @198a * //
analyzed: khyad par gang tshogs pa dang bral ba dag las 'bras bu yod pa med pa 'dra bar khyad par de nyid las 'bras bu skye'o // de la yod na zhes @198a * //
translated: If the effect were to exist in the assembly of causes and conditions, then it would be similar to the effect that exists in the assembly of causes and conditions that are devoid of the effect. The effect would arise from that very assembly.

original: bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por rung ba'i khyad par yod na 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por rung ba'i khyad par yod na 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, â€œif it existsâ€ means that if the effect exists in the assembly of causes and conditions, then the effect would exist in the form of a cause that is suitable.

original: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba ni khyad par las gzhan pa spyi las so //
analyzed: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba ni khyad par las gzhan pa spyi las so //
translated: â€œFrom thatâ€ means from the cause. â€œFrom anotherâ€ means from the universal that is different from the particular.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: â€œBecause of the absurd consequenceâ€ means that everything would be the cause of everything.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na khyad par kho na skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na khyad par kho na skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it is so, therefore it is only the specific that is productive.

original: de'i phyir de skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir khyad par de kho na dngos po yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir khyad par de kho na dngos po yod de /
translated: Therefore, because it is only that which is productive, that specific is an existent thing.

original: don dam par yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is ultimately existent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar don byed nus pa gang yin pa de nyid don dam par yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar don byed nus pa gang yin pa de nyid don dam par yod pa ste /
translated: Because that which is able to perform a function is ultimately existent.

original: dngos po don dam par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po don dam par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is an existent thing ultimately.

original: dngos po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: dngos po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with â€œThe characteristic of an existent is . . .â€

original: don byed par rung ba nyid ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin la mi rung ba nyid ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don byed par rung ba nyid ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin la mi rung ba nyid ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The characteristic of an existent is the capacity to perform a function, and the characteristic of a non-existent is the incapacity to perform a function.

original: don byed nus pa gang yin te ;
analyzed: don byed nus pa gang yin te ;
translated: What is able to perform a function?

original: 'dir ni don dam pa yod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni don dam pa yod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, he explains with â€œThat which is able to perform a function is ultimately existent . . .â€

original: don byed par rung ba'i don de khyad par gyi bdag nyid de yang rjes 'gro med pa ste /
analyzed: don byed par rung ba'i don de khyad par gyi bdag nyid de yang rjes 'gro med pa ste /
translated: That object which is suitable to perform a function is the nature of a particular.

original: khyad par ni gsal ba gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni gsal ba gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it does not follow, because a particular does not follow another instance.ğŸ”½That which follows is the nature of a universal. An effect does not exist from that.

original: gang zhig rjes 'gro ste spyi'i bdag nyid de las 'bras bu yod min de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig rjes 'gro ste spyi'i bdag nyid de las 'bras bu yod min de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: Thus, he concludes with â€œTherefore, etc.â€

original: don byed par rung ba med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni don byed par mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don byed par rung ba med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni don byed par mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is not suitable to perform a function means because it is not suitable to perform a function.

original: de kho na nyid las zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid las so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid las zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid las so //
translated: From reality means from a particular.

original: de grub pa ni don byed par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub pa ni don byed par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its establishment is the establishment of a function.

original: de bas na de ltar gzhan dag gis brtags pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar gzhan dag gis brtags pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the nature of a universal, as imagined by others, is not a cause.

original: da ni gzhan gyis gcig gi 'bras bu gzhan gyir ni /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyis gcig gi 'bras bu gzhan gyir ni /
translated: Now, another says that the effect of one is of another.

original: mi 'gyur shin tu tha dad phyir //
analyzed: mi 'gyur shin tu tha dad phyir //
translated: Because they are utterly different, they do not change.

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgol ba de nyid 'on kyang rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas zlog par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgol ba de nyid 'on kyang rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas zlog par byed de /
translated: In order to clarify that, the opponentâ€™s objection is refuted by â€œBut since there is no concomitance with essence . . .â€

original: lhan cig pa'am so so yis //
analyzed: lhan cig pa'am so so yis //
translated: â€œWhether together or separately,

original: rims la sogs pa zhi byed la //
analyzed: rims la sogs pa zhi byed la //
translated: the pacification of fever and so on . . . â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar de gong du yongs su btsal ba @198b de lta na yang lhag par bya ba'i don du yang bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar de gong du yongs su btsal ba @198b de lta na yang lhag par bya ba'i don du yang bkod pa yin no //
translated: Even though this was thoroughly investigated above, it is presented again for the sake of emphasis.

original: sa bon la sogs pa gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan sa la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa gzhan bskyed par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan sa la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa gzhan bskyed par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Since the nature of production of a single thing, such as a seed, does not exist in other things, such as the earth, the other cooperative conditions would not produce it.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin na tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa thams cad kyang s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin na tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa thams cad kyang s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the nature of the producer is different from the nature of the product, then since they are equally different, even barley seeds and so on would be producers of rice sprouts and so on.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning â€œBut that is not so.â€

original: s'a lu'i sa bon skyed par byed pa bdag nyid nges sa la sogs pa dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa shin tu tha dad kyang sa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig s'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon skyed par byed pa bdag nyid nges sa la sogs pa dang nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa shin tu tha dad kyang sa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig s'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The rice seed, which is the producer, is definitely different from rice sprouts and so on, and it is also definitely different from barley seeds and so on. But even though it is very different from barley seeds and so on, some rice seeds are causes of rice sprouts and so on,

original: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gzhan pa'ang yin no //ğŸ”½'ang gi sgra ni tshigs su bcad pa kha bskang ba'i don nam /
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gzhan pa'ang yin no // 'ang gi sgra ni tshigs su bcad pa kha bskang ba'i don nam /
translated: but other things, such as barley seeds, are not.ğŸ”½The word â€œbutâ€ is for the purpose of completing the verse,

original: kho na'i don yin no //
analyzed: kho na'i don yin no //
translated: or it is for the purpose of emphasis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di yin no //
translated: The nature of things is this.

original: gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de las te /
analyzed: gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de las te /
translated: the nature of that which produces is the same as that of that from which itğŸ”½arises, that is, the nature of the self.

original: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las thams cad tha dad par 'gyur ba mtshungs pa ste /ğŸ”½'dra ba skyed par byed pa thob par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las thams cad tha dad par 'gyur ba mtshungs pa ste / 'dra ba skyed par byed pa thob par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: All would be the same in being produced from the nature of the self.ğŸ”½Either one would have to say that the producer produces something similar,ğŸ”½or, because there would be no difference between that which is different,

original: tha dad khyad par med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba der 'gyur na zhes brgal ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad khyad par med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba der 'gyur na zhes brgal ba'o //
translated: nothing would be produced.ğŸ”½Just as the nature of that which produces is different from the self, it isğŸ”½not the case that the nature of that which is produced is not different fromğŸ”½the self.ğŸ”½But, although there is a difference, it is not the case that there is no difference

original: ji ltar gcig skyed par byed pa bdag nyid las tha dad pa de dag la de dang de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa skyed par byed pas so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'on kyang yod pa kho na
analyzed: ji ltar gcig skyed par byed pa bdag nyid las tha dad pa de dag la de dang de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa skyed par byed pas so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'on kyang yod pa kho na
translated: between the nature of that which produces and that which is produced.

original: yin no // de bas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin no // de bas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is a difference,ğŸ”½even though there is a difference, there is a difference in the nature of that

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par yod na yang 'ga' zhig las bdag nyid phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par yod na yang 'ga' zhig las bdag nyid phul du byung ba ste /
translated: which produces, which is the best, from some other.

original: khyad par can gyi 'bras bus so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi 'bras bus so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the effect is determined by the specific cause.

original: sa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa yin gyi nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa yin gyi nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Some, such as earth, etc., are the cause of the production of the rice sprout, not the seed of barley, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i khyad par de ni sa la sogs pa de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: s'a lu'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'i khyad par de ni sa la sogs pa de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The specific nature of the cause of the production of the rice sprout is the intrinsic nature of the co-operating cause of that, not of the seed of barley, etc.

original: @199a * // gal te rnam par 'byed pa 'dis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: @199a * // gal te rnam par 'byed pa 'dis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks what is the purpose of this analysis,

original: dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: he says, â€œbecause of the difference in the intrinsic nature of the thing, etc.â€

original: ci'i phyir me ni sreg par byed ba 'am dro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir me ni sreg par byed ba 'am dro ba yin gyi /
translated: Why is it that fire is hot and burning,ğŸ”½but water is not hot and burning?

original: chu ni sreg par byed pa'am dro ba ma yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chu ni sreg par byed pa'am dro ba ma yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a proper objection.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin 'di dag rgyu gang las 'gyur zhes bya ba dri ba de tsam ni rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rang bzhin 'di dag rgyu gang las 'gyur zhes bya ba dri ba de tsam ni rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: The question â€œFrom what cause do these natures explained above arise?â€ is reasonable.

original: gdon mi za bar rang bzhin tha dad pa rgyu las 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar rang bzhin tha dad pa rgyu las 'gyur gyi /
translated: Undoubtedly, different natures arise from causes.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu med pa can rgyu la ltos pa med pa ni yul la sogs pa nges pa med pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu med pa can rgyu la ltos pa med pa ni yul la sogs pa nges pa med pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because causeless things, which do not depend on causes, are not determined by place, time, and so on, it would follow, absurdly, that

original: thams cad la thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: everything would arise from everything, at all times, and in every way.

original: de bas na rgyur 'dod pa'i rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyur 'dod pa'i rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should say that the nature that is asserted to be a cause arises from its own cause.

original: rang gi rgyu de yang des bskyed pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu de yang des bskyed pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: And that cause of it is of the nature that it produces.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid de las rang gi rgyu gzhan las zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid de las rang gi rgyu gzhan las zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa can yin no //
translated: The nature that is of such a kind is the nature that produces its own cause from another cause. Thus, there is an infinite regress of causes.

original: dngos po tha dad pa dag gi rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa dag gi rgyu'i rab tu dbye ba la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: It is a valid cognition that contradicts the differentiation of causes of different things.

original: de nyid ni tha dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ni tha dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: He says just that in â€œBy the difference of those . . . â€ and so on.

original: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œBecause of being the natureâ€ means because of the stability of things.

original: gcig nyid la ni gnod pa can yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig nyid la ni gnod pa can yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the contradiction exists in oneness, he says,

original: tha dad min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œIf they are not different . . . â€ and so on.

original: phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig 'jig pa na cig car thams cad 'jig pa dang / skye ba na thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig 'jig pa na cig car thams cad 'jig pa dang / skye ba na thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of being mutually undifferentiated, when one is destroyed, all are simultaneously destroyed, and when one is produced, all are produced. This is the meaning.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains that in â€œThe nature . . . â€ and so on.

original: sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: â€œThe variousâ€

original: dngos po'i tshogs thams cad kyi rang bzhin la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i tshogs thams cad kyi rang bzhin la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means all the collections of things. Because of being undifferentiated in nature.

original: rnam par dbye ba skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gcig skye ba na gzhan skye ba dang gnas pa na gzhan 'gog pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par dbye bas skye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gcig skye ba na gzhan skye ba dang gnas pa na gzhan 'gog pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par dbye bas skye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: â€œThe analysis of origination, etc.â€ means that origination, etc. would not be like the analysis of origination, etc. in which one thing originates, another endures, and another ceases.

original: 'on kyang cig car nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang cig car nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Rather, they would all occur simultaneously.

original: rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na gcig gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na gcig gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: â€œLike oneâ€™s own natureâ€ means that, for example, the particular states of one thing are not analyzed as origination, etc.

original: de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of â€œlike that.â€

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gcig gzung ba na gzhan ma bzung ba zhes @199b bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gcig gzung ba na gzhan ma bzung ba zhes @199b bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ refers to such things as â€œwhen one is apprehended, the other is not apprehended.â€

original: mdo las skye 'jig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo las skye 'jig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The mention of origination and destruction in the sÅ«tra is an illustration.

original: de ltar ni rnam par dbye ba med pa'i skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa nye bar mtshon cing nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni rnam par dbye ba med pa'i skye ba la sogs pa nyid kyis tha dad pa nye bar mtshon cing nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Origination, etc. are illustrated and ascertained by the very fact that they are not analyzed as different.

original: gzhan du na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par gang gis mtshon par bya /
analyzed: gzhan du na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par gang gis mtshon par bya /
translated: Otherwise, by what would they be characterized as different or non-different?

original: rnam pa gcig la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mtshungs pa la yang ldog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mtshungs pa la yang ldog pa ste /
translated: Even in the case of a single aspect, there is exclusion, i.e., non-difference.

original: rnam par dbye ba so sor skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ni tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba so sor skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ni tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That which is endowed with the arising of individual differentiations, etc., has the characteristic of difference.

original: ldog pa med pa ste rnam par dbye ba med pas so sor skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ni tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa ste rnam par dbye ba med pas so sor skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ni tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which is not excluded, i.e., not differentiated, and is endowed with the arising of individual differentiations, etc., has the characteristic of non-difference.

original: rnam par dbye bas skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rnam par dbye bas skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is endowed with the arising of individual differentiations, etc.,

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: why is it different?

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œbecause of the contradiction of a single nature,â€ etc.

original: bdag nyid gcig la 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig la 'gal ba ste /
translated: There is a contradiction of a single nature,

original: skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising and non-arising, etc., are mutually contradictory.

original: don rnams ni tha dad pa med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don rnams ni tha dad pa med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: But the objects are not non-different.

original: 'on kyang gal te tha dad pa yang yod de rgyun des de ltar min te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te tha dad pa yang yod de rgyun des de ltar min te /
translated: But if they are different, then the continuum is not like that,

original: cig car skye ba la sogs par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car skye ba la sogs par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the consequence of their simultaneous arising and so on does not follow.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid rnam par 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid rnam par 'chad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained by all aspects and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: They are not different in all aspects.

original: gcig pa smra ba ma yin na gang gis de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig pa smra ba ma yin na gang gis de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If they are not said to be the same, then how could that be?

original: cig car skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: They would arise and disintegrate simultaneously.

original: 'on kyang phyi dang nang gi tha dad pa 'di'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi dang nang gi tha dad pa 'di'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig ste /
translated: But this is the nature of external and internal differences,

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid tha dad gzhan ma yin pa yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid pa de ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang rmongs pa'i bdag nyid du thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i gnas
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid tha dad gzhan ma yin pa yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid pa de ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang rmongs pa'i bdag nyid du thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i gnas
translated: which are not different from the characteristics of the different states. Since there is no difference in all beings in terms of the nature of the three qualities, which are the nature of pleasure, pain and delusion, and so on.

original: skabs kyi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: skabs kyi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: This is the context of the explanation.

original: // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: 19.ğŸ”½

original: de ltar te spyi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad la gnas la khyad par rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar te spyi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad la gnas la khyad par rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, because the universal is permanent, it abides in everything, but not the particulars.

original: khyad par rnams kyang 'jig pa yin no zhes khas len na'o //
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyang 'jig pa yin no zhes khas len na'o //
translated: And the particulars are destroyed.

original: de bas na khyad par gcig 'jig pa na spyi bdag nyid gnas pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par de'i rang bzhin min te /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par gcig 'jig pa na spyi bdag nyid gnas pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par de'i rang bzhin min te /
translated: Therefore, when one particular is destroyed, that which remains, the nature of the universal, is not the nature of that particular.

original: chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par dag ni tha dad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //ğŸ”½gzhan du na gnas pa dang gnas @200a * //
analyzed: chos 'gal ba gnas pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par dag ni tha dad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzhan du na gnas pa dang gnas @200a * //
translated: The universal and the particular are different, because contradictory attributes abide in them.

original: pa ma yin pa dag ni rten gyi bdag nyid gcig yin par khas len na /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa dag ni rten gyi bdag nyid gcig yin par khas len na /
translated: Otherwise, if abiding and non-abiding are accepted as having the same nature,

original: bdag nyid gcig la yang 'gal ba'i chos dag khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig la yang 'gal ba'i chos dag khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: then contradictory attributes are accepted as having the same nature.

original: de bas na tha dad pa can gyi chos gzhan ci zhig yod de 'ga' zhig kyang med do //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa can gyi chos gzhan ci zhig yod de 'ga' zhig kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, what other different attribute is there? There is none at all.

original: gcig la chos 'gal ba dag khas blangs pa byas pa med de gang gi phyir so sor skye ba la sogs pas khyad par ni rnam pa thams cad du tha dad pa dang ldan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gcig la chos 'gal ba dag khas blangs pa byas pa med de gang gi phyir so sor skye ba la sogs pas khyad par ni rnam pa thams cad du tha dad pa dang ldan pa yin zhing /
